premium on inclusiveness diversity collaboration so a lot of the attributes
of the community were baked in from the very start I've my experience with the community has always been almost
exclusively a positive one I've watched people come into the community who knew nothing about kubernetes nothing about
cloud native and see other members of the community tried to help them out get them started if they're unclear about
how to contribute if they wanted to get a job people would point out the different companies that were hiring and
that would be a good fit for them so I think just from the way the community started we started with the right intent
we started inclusiveness from the start and that's just grown over time it's
hard for me to say you know what we've missed the boat on because that almost assumes that there's a perfect end state
which there isn't you know we're always going to mess something up at some point but I think where we've done the best is
the community as a whole is always trying we're always listening to others when a problem arises we're always
responding as things come up and a perfect example is actually something
that led up to this event that I was actually involved in there was a dispute
on Twitter because Twitter that involved only making some comments you know sort
of trying to tone police others and people sort of jumped on her about that
then a friend of hers sort of jumped on them you know trying to white knight the
situation which led to others sort of piling on and in turn a person that was
a friend of the original white knight started making some videos and tweeting
about you know why this was unfair even though what his friend said was wrong and turns out this person was going to
come to cube con and you know I'm a grown man I'm not you know put off by
people I disagree with being in the same place that I am but I wondered whether others would feel the same or even feel
like they could speak up about this person that was causing a lot of harm over the weeks that this incident was
going on and I just said hey I'm not sure I wouldn't even want to come to cube cotton if this person is in attendance and so many members that
community reached out to me either publicly or privately folks on the program committee reached out and said
hey you know what would you do with this person and actually sought my advice on it and I gave it and they actually

systemic concerns you think just prevent folks from participating I think there's

you have is privileged so I think that we should focus on leveling that playing

be good be good the problem with meritocracy is that it doesn't exist there's no such thing I

yeah anything just a dogpile you know
there have been studies done on github where female contributors there commits
